title: Trump Secures Trade Deal with Vietnam, Eases Tariff Threats
snippets: The announcement came after President Trump in April proposed a steep 46% tariff on Vietnamese imports; he later paused those tariffs while talks continued.
Any transshipment will face 40 percent levy, while Vietnam will accept US goods tariff-free.
Stock investors waver on U.S.-Vietnam trade deal
Trump says U.S. strikes trade deal with Vietnam  Axios</
Vietnam, whose exports to the U.S. reportedly comprised 30% of its gross domestic product last year, is especially vulnerable to Trump's tariffs.
Every weekday, the Investing Club releases the Homestretch; an actionable afternoon update just in time for the last hour of trading.
The president said he had agreed to initial trade terms with Vietnam, the second country to strike a limited deal after Mr. Trump threatened steep tariffs.
President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with Hanoi that would levy 20% on imports and a 40% tariff on transshipment from Vietnam.
Trump said the U.S. will impose a 20% tariff on Vietnamese exports to the U.S. Goods transshipped through Vietnam will get 40%.

summary: After negotiations, President Trump agreed to initial trade terms with Vietnam, making it the second country to reach a deal following tariff threats. The agreement comes after Trump proposed a 46% tariff on Vietnamese imports in April, which he later paused. Under the new terms, any transshipment will incur a 40% levy, but Vietnam will accept US goods tariff-free. This deal is significant for Vietnam, as its exports to the U.S. last year accounted for 30% of its GDP.
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights progress in the form of a trade deal, and provides useful information about the terms of the deal and its potential impacts. title: Ferry Sinks Near Bali: 4 Dead, 30 Missing, 31 Rescued
snippets: The ferry sank almost half an hour after leaving Ketapang port in the East Java town of Banyuwangi late Wednesday, bound for Bali's Gilimanuk port, a 30-mile trip.
A ferry carrying 65 people capsized overnight between the islands of Java and Bali. At least four people died in the incident, 38 are missing and 23 more have been rescued so far.

Thirty-one people who were on the ferry travelling from Java have so far been rescued, Indonesia police say

At least four people have died and dozens are missing after a ferry carrying 65 people sank on its way to the Indonesian resort island of Bali, according to local police.

GILIMANUK, Indonesia (AP) — Rescuers were searching Thursday for 30 people who were missing after a ferry sank and four people died the previous night near Indonesia’s resort island of Bali. As of Thursday afternoon, 31 people had been rescued from the ferry’s 53 passengers and 12 crew members

title: Diddy Found Guilty on Prostitution Charges, Acquitted on Racketeering
snippets: Combs will remain behind bars because of his history of violence, the judge said, setting sentencing for October.
A New York jury found rapper Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs not guilty of sexual trafficking and engaging in a criminal enterprise.

The hip-hop icon was accused of transporting to engage in prostitution but cleared of the more serious charges of sex trafficking, racketeering and conspiracy. Denied bail, he will remain in jail until sentencing.
The Sean "Diddy" Combs' trial tested the limits of fame, power, consent and of the #MeToo movement in an era of AI misinformation and manosphere backlash.
Sean "Diddy" Combs found guilty of prostitution charges
It was a bold gambit that used a strategy typically reserved for organized crime cases to prosecute a music legend for alleged violence, threats and payoffs.

summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs was found guilty on two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution but was acquitted on charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking. The verdict came after nearly two months of trial and three days of jury deliberations. Despite being cleared of the more serious charges, Combs still faces up to 20 years in prison. The trial, which highlighted issues of fame, power, and the #MeToo movement, ended with a mixed verdict, and jurors were asked to continue deliberations for a full verdict.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides some useful context about the trial and its implications, particularly in relation to issues of fame, power, and the #MeToo movement. title: Rare Double-Detonation Supernova Observed by Astronomers
snippets: Astronomers studying the remnant SNR 0509-67.5 have finally caught a white dwarf in the act of a rare “double-detonation” supernova, where an initial helium blast on the star’s surface triggers a second, core-shattering explosion.
Pictures of a distant supernova remnant show two concentric rings, providing clear evidence that exploding white dwarf stars go boom twice in the blink of an eye
titles: A star exploded twice — First-ever image reveals its cosmic fingerprint
Stunning image of a supernova reveals a dead star that exploded twice
summary: Astronomers have observed a white dwarf star undergoing a rare "double-detonation" supernova in the remnant SNR 0509-67.5. This event involves an initial helium explosion on the star's surface, followed by a second explosion that shatters its core. Evidence of this phenomenon was found in images showing two concentric rings around the supernova remnant, confirming the dual explosion process.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides a deeper understanding of a rare astronomical phenomenon. It is useful for those interested in astronomy, and it increases awareness about the dynamics of supernova explosions. However, it does not directly report on solutions, improvements, or innovations.
